name: calva
description: A complete Clojure IDE. Integrated REPL, formatter, Paredit, Parinfer, and more. Powered by cider-nrepl and clojure-lsp.

badges.description: Let's talk in the #calva channel at the Clojurians Slack

untrustedWorkspaces.description: With Calva you might evaluate any code in the project.

printEngine.description: The print engine to use. 'calva' means that the nREPL server will first plain print it and then Calva will prettify. The other options will make the server use the chosen printer-function to print the result, and Calva will not reformat it. To use some other function (on the server), configure `printFn` instead. To use the `nREPL` default (the equivalent of `clojure.core/pr`), set neither this nore `printFn`.

name.markdownDescription: A symbol referencing a Clojure function to use for printing result values. E.g. `pr`. Or `foo.bar/baz`.

maxWidthArgument.markdownDescription: Argument that the function uses for setting the max-width of the lines printed. E.g. `width`.

seqLimitArgument.markdownDescription: Argument that the function uses for truncating the number of elements to print  for sequences. E.g. `length`.

maxDepthArgument.markdownDescription: Argument that the function uses for limiting the depth that collections are traversed. E.g. `levels`.

width.description: The width of the printing. Or line length... Hmmm, you get it, I hope.

maxLength.description: The maximum number of forms to print of each collection. For no limit, do not include this in your setting. See https://clojuredocs.org/clojure.core/*print-length*

maxDepth.description: The maximum number of levels deep the printing will go in nested objects. For no limit, do not include this in your setting. Does not exist for `puget`. See also https://clojuredocs.org/clojure.core/*print-level*

clojure.trace.server.description: Trace communication between Calva and the Clojure language server, clojure-lsp. Trace messages are displayed in the Clojure Language Client output channel.

calva.referencesCodeLens.enabled.description: Enable/disable references CodeLens in Clojure(Script) files.

calva.evalOnSave.description: Run load-file when opening a new file and on file save

calva.testOnSave.description: Run namespace tests on file save

calva.showDocstringInParameterHelp.description: Show the docstring in the parameter hints

calva.statusColor.description: Configuration for custom coloring of the statusbar.

disconnectedColor.description: Foreground color for the disconnected status

launchingColor.description: Foreground color for the launching status

connectedStatusColor.description: Foreground color for the connected status

typeStatusColor.description: Foreground color for the type status

disconnectedColor.description: Foreground color for the disconnected status

launchingColor.description: Foreground color for the launching status

connectedStatusColor.description: Foreground color for the connected status

typeStatusColor.description: Foreground color for the type status

calva.customCljsRepl.deprecationMessage: This settings is deprecated. Use `cljsType` in a `calva.replConnectSequences` item instead.

calva.jackInEnv.description: Specifies any environment variables your project needs. (Probably mostly for your Workspace Settings.)

calva.jackInDependencyVersions.description: Versions of the dependencies injected by Calva Jack-in

nrepl.description: nREPL is the wonderful piece of software that gives Calva a structured and extensible connection to the REPL in your Clojure and ClojureScript projects.

cider-nrepl.description: cider-nrepl is middleware that extends the nREPL connection with all sorts of nice stuff that Calva uses to give you a delightful IDE experience.

cider/piggieback.description: Piggieback is used to create nREPL sessions in ClojureScript projects (not with shadow-cljs though, which provides its own middleware for this.

calva.clojureLspVersion.markdownDescription: The version of `clojure-lsp` to download and use. A release tag-name or `latest`. (Will take effect after a reload of the project window.) Remove this setting to switch back to using the current Calva default (`latest`).

calva.clojureLspPath.markdownDescription: The absolute path to the `clojure-lsp` native binary you want Calva to use. When this setting is non-blank, the `calva.clojureLspVersion` setting will be ignored. The binary at the path set here will be used and Calva will not overwrite it. (Will take effect after a reload of the project window.)

calva.openBrowserWhenFigwheelStarted.description: (lein-figwheel only) Should Calva open the Figwheel app for you when Figwheel has been started?

calva.customREPLCommandSnippets.description: Configuration for the command **Run Custom REPL Command**

name.markDownDescription: The name of the command will show in the **Run Custom REPL Command** quick-pick menu.

key.markdownDescription: The key can be used to reference the snippet from **Run Custom REPL Command** keyboard shortcut arguments. This key will also be used in the quick-pick menu.

snippet.description: Command to send to the REPL

ns.description: (optional) Namespace to evaluate the command in. If omitted the command will be executed in the namespace of the current file.

repl.description: Choose which REPL should the code should be evaluated in. If omitted, the same REPL as for the current file will be used.

calva.myLeinProfiles.description: At Jack in, any profiles listed here will be added to the profiles found in the `project.clj` file.

calva.myCljAliases.description: At Jack in, any aliases listed here will be added to the aliases found in the project's `deps.edn` file.

calva.replConnectSequences.description: For when your project needs a custom REPL connect sequence.

name.description: This will show up in the Jack-in quick-pick menu when you start Jack-in if you have more than one sequence configured.

projectType.description: Select one of the project types supported by Calva.

nReplPortFile.description: An array of path segments with the project root-relative path to the nREPL port file for this connect sequence. E.g. For shadow-cljs this would be [".shadow-cljs", "nrepl.port"]

afterCLJReplJackInCode.description: Here you can give Calva some Clojure code to evaluate in the CLJ REPL, once it has been created.

menuSelections.description: Pre-selected menu options. If a selection is made here. Calva won't prompt for it.

leinProfiles.description: At Jack-in to a Leiningen project, use these profiles to launch the repl.

leinAlias.description: At Jack-in to a Leiningen project, launch with this alias. Set to null to launch with Calva's default task (a headless repl).

cljAliases.description: At Jack-in to a deps.edn project, use these aliases to launch the repl.

cljsLaunchBuilds.description: The cljs builds to start/watch at Jack-in/connect.

cljsDefaultBuild.description: Which cljs build to attach to at the initial connect.

cljsType.description: Either a built in type, or an object configuring a custom type. If omitted Calva will show a menu with the built-in types.

dependsOn.description: The ClojureScript REPL dependencies this customization needs. NB: If it is `User provided`, then you need to provide the dependencies in the project, or launch with an alias (deps.edn), profile (Leiningen), or build (shadow-cljs) that provides the dependencies needed.

buildsRequired.description: If the repl type requires that builds are started in order to connect to them, set this to true.

isStarted.description: For cljs repls that Calva does not need to start, set this to true. (If you base your custom cljs repl on shadow-cljs workflow, for instance.)

startCode.description: Clojure code to be evaluated to create and/or start your custom CLJS REPL.

isReadyToStartRegExp.description: A regular expression which, when matched in the stdout from the startCode evaluation, will make Calva continue with connecting the REPL, and to prompt the user to start the application. If omitted and there is startCode Calva will continue when that code is evaluated.

openUrlRegExp.description: A regular expression, matched against the stdout of cljsType evaluations, for extracting the URL with which the app can be started. The expression should have a capturing group named 'url'. E.g. \”Open URL: (?<url>\S+)\”

shouldOpenUrl.description: Choose if Calva should automatically open the URL for you or not.

connectCode.description: Clojure code to be evaluated to convert the REPL to a CLJS REPL that Calva can use to connect to the application.

isConnectedRegExp.description: A regular expression which, when matched in the stdout of the connectCode evaluation, will tell Calva that the application is connected.

printThisLineRegExp.description: A regular expression which, when matched in the stdout from any code evaluations in the cljsType, will make the matched text be printed to the Output/REPL window.

jackInEnv.markdownDescription: Environment variables that will be merged with any global `calva.jackInEnv` and then applied to the Jack-in process. The merge is very similar to how Clojure's `merge` works. So for any common keys between the global setting and this one, the ones from this setting will win.

calva.enableJSCompletions.description: Should Calva use suitible and bring you JavaScript completions? This is an experimental cider-nrepl feature. Disable if completions start to throw errors.

calva.autoOpenREPLWindow.markdownDescription: Automatically open the REPL window on Jack-in or Connect.

calva.autoOpenJackInTerminal.markdownDescription: Automatically open the the Jack-in Terminal on Jack-in.

calva.hideReplUi.markdownDescription: Don't surface REPL UI elements when avoidable. (For when using another REPL extension together with Calva's static features.)

calva.showCalvaSaysOnStart.markdownDescription: Show the Calva Says output panel on start?

calva.paredit.defaultKeyMap.description: The default keymap to use for bindings when there is no custom binding.

calva.paredit.hijackVSCodeDefaults.markdownDescription: When enabled, more VS Code built-in shortcuts are overridden with their ”corresponding” Paredit commands.

calva.paredit.killAlsoCutsToClipboard.markdownDescription: When enabled, replaces the clipboard content with the deleted code.

calva.paredit.strictPreventUnmatchedClos.markdownDescription: Prevents you from entering unmatched closing brackets when in `strict` mode.

calva.paredit.strictAutoClosingBrackets.markdownDescription: In `strict` mode, will add a closing bracket when an open bracket is typed.

calva.fmt.configPath.markdownDescription: Path to [cljfmt](https://github.com/weavejester/cljfmt#configuration) configuration file. Absolute or relative to the project root directory.

calva.fmt.newIndentEngine.markdownDescription: Use the structural editor for indentation (instead of `cljfmt`).

calva.fmt.keepCommentTrailParenOnOwnLine.markdownDescription: Treat `(comment...)` forms special and keep its closing paren on a line of its own.

calva.fmt.experimental.fullFormatOnType.markdownDescription: _Experimental_. Keeps the code formatted as you enter or delete text (as opposed to only doing indentation). _NB: When `calva.fmt.experimental.inferParensAsYouType` is enabled this setting will be treated as enabled, regardless._

calva.fmt.experimental.inferParensAsYouT.markdownDescription: _Experimental_. Parinfer **indent mode**. Infers brackets from indentation when you type spaces or brackets.

calva.fmt.experimental.alertOnParinferPr.markdownDescription: _Experimental_. When Parinfer **indent mode** is on, show alert when structure or indents do not allow inference. (This is always indicated in the statusbar.)

calva.highlight.rainbowIndentGuides.markdownDescription: Use rainbow indent guides. (To use built-in indent guides, disable this and enable built-in guides in `["clojure"]` scope.

calva.highlight.highlightActiveIndent.description: Highlight active indent with a guideline. (Unlike the VS Code built-in setting, this works independently of the rainbowIndentGuides setting.)

anyOf.markdownDescription: Tuple of CSS colors, `[light, dark]`, e.g. `["#ccc", "#000"]`

calva.highlight.bracketColors.markdownDescription: An array where each element can be either a CSS color string, or a tuple of two CSS color strings. Use tuples when you want a different color for light and dark themes, `[light, dark]`, e.g. `["#ccc", "#000"]`

calva.highlight.cycleBracketColors.description: If nesting level is greater than amount of colors, start counting over

commands.title: Instrument Top Level Form for Debugging
Toggle Pretty Printing for All Evaluations
Start a Project REPL and Connect (aka Jack-In)
Connect to a Running REPL Server in the Project
Connect to a Running REPL Server, not in Project
Start or Connect to a Clojure REPL
Start a standalone REPL (not in a project)
Fire up the ClojureScript Quick Start Browser REPL
Fire up the ClojureScript Quick Start Node REPL
Toggle the REPL Connection (clj or cljs) used for CLJC Files
Evaluate Current Form  (or selection, if any)
Evaluate From Start of List to Cursor
Evaluate From Start of Top Level Form to Cursor
Evaluate From Start of File to Cursor
Tap Current Form (or selection, if any)
Evaluate Current Form and Replace it with the Result
Evaluate Top Level Form (defun) to Comment
Print Last Stacktrace to Output Window
Copy Last Evaluation Result to Clipboard
Require REPL utilities, like (doc) etcetera, into Current Namespace
Continue Comment (add a commented line below).
Select Current Top Level (aka defun) Form
Transpose (Swap) the two Sexps Around the Cursor
Kill/Delete Forward to End of List
Kill/Delete Backward to Start of List
Format and Align Current Form (recursively, experimental)
Show File for the Current Output/REPL Window Namespace
Switch Namespace in Output/REPL Window to Current Namespace
Send Current Form to Output/REPL Window
Send Current Top Level Form to Output/REPL Window
Print clojuredocs.org examples to Rich Comment

keybindings.when: calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap =~ /original|strict/ && !config.calva.paredit.hijackVSCodeDefaults && !calva:cursorInComment || calva:cursorBeforeComment

calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap =~ /original|strict/ && config.calva.paredit.hijackVSCodeDefaults && !calva:cursorInComment || calva:cursorBeforeComment

calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap =~ /original|strict/ && !config.calva.paredit.hijackVSCodeDefaults && !calva:cursorInComment || calva:cursorAfterComment

calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap =~ /original|strict/ && config.calva.paredit.hijackVSCodeDefaults && !calva:cursorInComment || calva:cursorAfterComment
calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap =~ /strict/ && config.calva.paredit.hijackVSCodeDefaults && !calva:cursorInComment
calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap =~ /strict/ && config.calva.paredit.hijackVSCodeDefaults && !calva:cursorInComment
calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap == strict && !editorReadOnly && !editorHasMultipleSelections && !calva:cursorInComment
calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap == strict && !editorReadOnly && !editorHasMultipleSelections
calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap == strict && !editorReadOnly && !editorHasMultipleSelections && !calva:cursorInComment
calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap != strict && !editorReadOnly && !editorHasMultipleSelections && !calva:cursorInComment
calva:keybindingsEnabled && editorLangId == clojure && editorTextFocus && paredit:keyMap == strict && !editorReadOnly && !editorHasMultipleSelections

scripts.prewatch: npm i && npm run clean && npm run update-grammar && npm run compile-cljs
scripts.release: npm i && npm run clean && npm run update-grammar && npm run release-cljs && webpack --mode production
scripts.bump-version: npm set git-tag-version false && npm version patch
